title: How to Nurture a Neglected Stuffed Toy

steps.headline: If your toy has any seams coming apart, sew them up.
steps.description: Be sure you know how to do so beforehand. If not, ask a friend or relative to do it for you or show you how. Think of it as your toy visiting the doctor!

steps.headline: Does your toy have a name?
steps.description: If not, give him/her one! Do they have a gender? Give them one! Stuck for names? Go on a baby name website and make sure the name fits your toy. You wouldn't want to name a pink teddy bear 'Blue', or a zebra toy 'Spots' unless it's a joke name.

steps.headline: If your toy is dirty, clean them.
steps.description: You can machine or hand wash (depending on the stuffed toy's condition or requirements) your stuffed toy to ensure a clean, happy toy to play with.

steps.headline: Get a shoe box (if your toy is small) or a cardboard box (if your toy is large).
steps.description: Glue wrapping paper onto the 'walls' of the box. Buy some felt or a towel and cut a square to fit the 'floor' of the box. You might like to cut off one 'wall' so you can reach things easily inside of the house.

steps.headline: Sew or buy a small pillow to fit the head of your toy.
steps.description: Make a blanket or find a clean washcloth and place both inside to make a bed. If you would like to, get a even smaller box and put the sheets and pillow inside of it to make it even more realistic of a bed.

steps.headline: Optional: Sew your stuffed toy a little friend!
steps.description: After all, you don't want them to get lonely! If you sew a friend, you may want to make him a little bed to go in the house as well.

steps.headline: Decorate their house.
steps.description:
Some ideas include:
A shelf with plastic food (small)
A mini 'bookshelf' full of 'books' (folded pieces of paper)
A 'houseplant' (a small plastic tree or flower in a little tin)
Whatever else you can think of! Remember, don't make their house too crowded or they won't have room to walk around!

steps.headline: Maybe even make the shelves, bookshelves, wardrobes/closets etc.
It's important your toy doesn't get too cold or hot!
steps.description: So make (or buy) your toy some clothes to make sure he or she is 'comfortable'.

steps.headline: Scarf: Buy a ball of warm yarn.
steps.description: Finger nit it (look this up on WikiHow). Once you have a chain long enough to go round their neck three times, finish off the chain. Wrap it around their neck and loosen it. You don't want to strangle them!

steps.headline: Dress: Get a long (not too wide) piece of fabric and wrap it around your toy's chest.
steps.description: When one end of the cloth meets the other, cut the fabric. Sew the gap up (be careful not to sew it to your toy!). Tie a 'belt' around the dress (A ribbon) into a bow.

steps.headline: Shirt: See Make Teddy Bears Clothes
Beanie: Find or buy a baby's beanie that fits your toy.
Sunglasses: Cut some sunglasses out of cardboard.
steps.description: Stick some cellophane to the lenses. Ta-da!

steps.headline: Raincoat: Buy a baby raincoat or use one of your old ones.
Wellies: Use baby ones.
Make as many as you want in different fabrics and colours.
steps.description: If you don't think you have enough types of clothes, use some baby clothes or invent a way to make some clothes. Use your imagination!

steps.headline: Remember to cuddle your stuffed toy at night so they don't get cold!
Give them a kiss when you wake up and a quick cuddle during the day.
Play games with your stuffed toy such as chess or checkers (you might have to do their moves for them!
Play doctor with them.
Play with them outside.
steps.description: If they are washable then put them on the (clean) trampoline and bounce on with them. As long as they don't fall of or get trodden on, they will love this!

text:
Fixing If your toy has any seams coming apart, sew them up. Be sure you know how to do so beforehand. If not, ask a friend or relative to do it for you or show you how. Think of it as your toy visiting the doctor! Does your toy have a name? If not, give him/her one! Do they have a gender? Give them one! Stuck for names? Go on a baby name website and make sure the name fits your toy. You wouldn't want to name a pink teddy bear 'Blue', or a zebra toy 'Spots' unless it's a joke name. If your toy is dirty, clean them. You can machine or hand wash (depending on the stuffed toy's condition or requirements) your stuffed toy to ensure a clean, happy toy to play with. A Home Get a shoe box (if your toy is small) or a cardboard box (if your toy is large). Glue wrapping paper onto the 'walls' of the box. Buy some felt or a towel and cut a square to fit the 'floor' of the box. You might like to cut off one 'wall' so you can reach things easily inside of the house. Sew or buy a small pillow to fit the head of your toy. Make a blanket or find a clean washcloth and place both inside to make a bed. If you would like to, get a even smaller box and put the sheets and pillow inside of it to make it even more realistic of a bed. Optional: Sew your stuffed toy a little friend! After all, you don't want them to get lonely! If you sew a friend, you may want to make him a little bed to go in the house as well. Decorate their house. Some ideas include:
A shelf with plastic food (small)
A mini 'bookshelf' full of 'books' (folded pieces of paper)
A 'houseplant' (a small plastic tree or flower in a little tin)
Whatever else you can think of! Remember, don't make their house too crowded or they won't have room to walk around! Maybe even make the shelves, bookshelves, wardrobes/closets etc. with woodwork! Clothes It's important your toy doesn't get too cold or hot! So make (or buy) your toy some clothes to make sure he or she is 'comfortable'. Scarf: Buy a ball of warm yarn. Finger nit it (look this up on WikiHow). Once you have a chain long enough to go round their neck three times, finish off the chain. Wrap it around their neck and loosen it. You don't want to strangle them! Dress: Get a long (not too wide) piece of fabric and wrap it around your toy's chest. When one end of the cloth meets the other, cut the fabric. Sew the gap up (be careful not to sew it to your toy!). Tie a 'belt' around the dress (A ribbon) into a bow. Shirt: See Make Teddy Bears Clothes  Beanie: Find or buy a baby's beanie that fits your toy.  Sunglasses: Cut some sunglasses out of cardboard. Stick some cellophane to the lenses. Ta-da! Raincoat: Buy a baby raincoat or use one of your old ones.  Wellies: Use baby ones.  Make as many as you want in different fabrics and colours. If you don't think you have enough types of clothes, use some baby clothes or invent a way to make some clothes. Use your imagination! Cuddles Remember to cuddle your stuffed toy at night so they don't get cold!  Give them a kiss when you wake up and a quick cuddle during the day.  Games Play games with your stuffed toy such as chess or checkers (you might have to do their moves for them! ). Play doctor with them.  Play with them outside. If they are washable then put them on the (clean) trampoline and bounce on with them. As long as they don't fall of or get trodden on, they will love this!
